definition: gold/chemical element Au/generic term for lustrous and ductile metals/money/golden/highly respected/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: The Taliban also banned, wouldn’t you know it, the keeping of songbirds.
sentences.chinese: 你不难猜出，塔利班同样禁止了留养金丝雀。

sentences.english: Canaries were formerly used in coal mines for this reason.
sentences.chinese: 为此原因，露天煤矿以前经常使用金丝雀。

sentences.english: Canaries no longer in coal mines for a reason.
sentences.chinese: 煤矿里不再有金丝雀了，这是有原因的。

sentences.english: What kind of companies are here in Canary Wharf?
sentences.chinese: 金丝雀码头有哪些公司？

sentences.english: Canary Wharf looks different compared to other parts of London.
sentences.chinese: 比起伦敦的其他地方，金丝雀码头看上去很不一样。

sentences.english: “Mumbai is a golden songbird, ” he said.
Some cats like to catch small birds, like canaries.
sentences.chinese: 有些猫喜欢抓小鸟，比如金丝雀。

sentences.english: They are, quite literally, the canaries in the coal mine.
sentences.chinese: 打个比方，他们就是煤矿里的金丝雀。

sentences.english: Welcome to Four Seasons Hotel London at Canary Wharf.
sentences.chinese: 欢迎来到伦敦金丝雀码头四季酒店。

sentences.english: I gotta start eating leaner canaries.
sentences.chinese: 我要开始吃瘦点的金丝雀了。

sentences.english: I work as an escort in Canary Wharf.
The hawk, the seagull, have far more possess'd me than the.
sentences.chinese: 雄鹰，海鸥，比金丝雀或者山鸟更遥远地。

sentences.english: The canary warbled all day long .
sentences.chinese: 那只金丝雀整天在鸣叫。

sentences.english: Your software project might have its own kind of pit canary.
sentences.chinese: 您的软件项目也可以有自己的矿井金丝雀。

sentences.english: The canary was trilling away in its cage.
sentences.chinese: 那只金丝雀在笼中鸣啾。

sentences.english: I coaxed the canary into the cage.
sentences.chinese: 那只金丝雀在笼中鸣啾。

definition: bird/CL:隻|只[zhi1],群[qun2]/(dialect) to pay attention to/(intensifier) damned/goddam
to rear (an animal) in an enclosure
to keep (an animal)/to look after the needs of (a person or an animal)/(fig.) to keep (a spy, lackey etc) in one's pay
(bird species of China) Eurasian skylark (Alauda arvensis)
